src:
Paulo Paulino Guajajara, penjaga hutan Amazon yang dibunuh pembalak liar
03 Nov 2019, 05:40 by BBC


Paulo Paulino Guajajara selama ini berjuang melawan pembalakan liar di hutan Amazon.

Paulo Paulino Guajajara, pemuda dari komunitas suku asli di hutan Amazon, Brasil, tewas ditembak pembalak liar. Ini adalah akhir kisah seorang pejuang lingkungan yang hendak menyelamatkan Amazon dari penebangan pohon ilegal.
Guajajara dilaporkan diserang dan terkena tembakan di bagian kepala saat tengah berburu, Jumat (01/11). Saat itu ia berada di kawasan hutan lindung milik kelompok adat, Arariboia, di negara bagian Maranhao.
Guajajara merupakan anggota Guardian of the Forest, sebuah kelompok yang dibentuk untuk melawan kartel pembalakan liar di kawasan tersebut.


Dulu saling bunuh, kini suku-suku asli Brasil bersatu demi selamatkan hutan Amazon


Sekilas kehidupan di hulu Amazon 150 tahun lalu


Binatang yang terperangkap di kebakaran hutan Amazon


Pembunuhan terhadap Guajajara menunjukkan kekerasan yang semakin kerap terjadi terhadap orang-orang yang berupaya melindungi Amazon.
Lembaga sipil nirlaba, Survival International, yang mengadvokasi komunitas rentan, menyebut sebelumnya tiga anggota Guardian of the Forest tewas. Serangan itu juga menyasar sanak famili mereka.
September lalu, seorang pejabat pemerintahan yang bekerja untuk melindungi masyarakat adat juga dibunuh di Tabatinga, kota di sisi barat laut Amazon.
Presiden Brasil yang dikenal populis, Jair Bolsonaro, disorot publik dalam negeri dan internasional. Ia dikritik karena gagal melindungi para pejuang Amazon.
Bolsonaro kerap menyatakan mendukung petani dan para penebang pohon yang bekerja di Amazon. Di sisi lain, ia mengkritik para pengkampanye lingkungan dan memotong anggaran badan lingkungan hidup Brasil.
Menteri Hukum Brasil, Sergio Moro, mengatakan bahwa kepolisian di tingkat federal tengah menyelidiki pembunuhan terhadap Guajajara. "Kami akan membuang waktu sia-sia untuk menyeret pelaku ke meja hijau," ujarnya.


Paulo Paulino Guajajara membawa senjata saat berkeliling mengintai aktivitas penebang pohon liar, September lalu.

Apa yang terjadi terhadap Guajajara?
Otoritas keamanan Brasil menyebut Guajajara ditembak di bagian kepala. Ia diserang sejumlah pembalak liar yang menginvasi kawasan lindung tersebut.
Seorang anggota adat lainnya,Tainaky Tenetehar, juga terluka akibat serangan itu.
Kepolisian Brasil menyebut salah satu pembalak liar tewas dalam kontak tembak tersebut.
Bagaimana reaksi publik atas kejadian ini?
Lembaga yang berfokus mengadvokasi dan mewakili 900 ribu masyarakat asli Amazon, APIB, menuding pemerintahan Bolsonaro wajib menjawab beragam tuntutan dan ketidakpercayaan.
"Ada darah pribumi di tangan pemerintahannya," demikian pernyataan tertulis APIB.


Kekerasan terhadap para penjaga Amazon yang meningkat memicu atensi publik.

"Kekerasan yang terus meningkat di wilayah masyarakat asli adalah dampak langsung dari pidato-pidato bernuansa kebenciannya dan sejumlah kebijakan yang menekan kami," kata APIB.
Siapa Paulo Paulino Guajajara?
Pejuang penyelamat wilayah suku asli yang wafat di usia akhir 30-an tahun itu merupakan pimpinan suku Guajajara. Ia memiliki seorang putra.


Paulo Paulino Guajajara meninggalkan seorang putra.

Guajajara adalah salah satu kelompok suku terbesar di Brasil, terdiri dari sekitar 20 ribu orang. Tahun 2012, mereka membentuk Guardian of the Forest untuk melindungi wilayah adat Arariboia.
"Saya takut beberapa kali, tapi kami harus mendongak dan mengambil sikap. Kami berdiri di sini untuk berjuang," ujar Guajajara kepada kantor berita Reuters, tengah tahun ini.
"Ada banyak perusakan lingkungan yang sedang terjadi. Pohon dengan kayu sekeras besi ditebang dan dibawa keluar dari Amazon."
"Kami harus melindunginya demi masa depan anak dan cucu kami," kata Guajajara.
text:
Paulo Paulino Guajajara, Amazon forest guard who was killed by illegal loggers
03 Nov 2019, 05:40 by BBC


Paulo Paulino Guajajara has been battling illegal logging in the Amazon jungle.

Paulo Paulino Guajajara, a young man from a native tribal community in the Brazilian Amazon, was shot dead by illegal loggers. This is the end of the story of an environmental warrior who wants to save the Amazon from illegal logging.
Guajajara was reportedly attacked and shot in the head while hunting, Friday (01/11). At that time he was in the protected forest area belonging to an indigenous group, Arariboia, in the state of Maranhao.
Guajajara is a member of the Guardian of the Forest, a group formed to fight illegal logging cartels in the region.


Once killed, now indigenous Brazilian tribes unite to save the Amazon jungle


A glimpse of life in the Amazon upstream 150 years ago


An animal trapped in an Amazon forest fire


The killing of Guajajara shows the increasingly frequent violence against people who are trying to protect the Amazon.
The non-profit civilian organization, Survival International, which advocates for vulnerable communities, said previously three members of the Guardian of the Forest were killed. The attack also targeted their relatives.
Last September, a government official working to protect indigenous peoples was also killed in Tabatinga, a city on the northwestern side of the Amazon.
The popular Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, was highlighted by the domestic and international public. He was criticized for failing to protect Amazon warriors.
Bolsonaro often says he supports farmers and loggers who work in the Amazon. On the other hand, he criticized environmental campaigners and cut Brazil's environmental agency budget.
Brazilian Law Minister Sergio Moro said that federal police were investigating the murder of Guajajara. "We will waste time trying to drag the perpetrators to justice," he said.


Paulo Paulino Guajajara was carrying a weapon while walking around staking out illegal loggers last September.

What happened to Guajajara?
Brazilian security authorities said Guajajara was shot in the head. He was attacked by a number of illegal loggers who invaded the protected area.
Another indigenous member, Tainaky Tenetehar, was also injured in the attack.
Brazilian police said one illegal logger was killed in the crossfire.
How is the public reaction to this incident?
An institution that focuses on advocating and representing 900 thousand indigenous Amazon people, APIB, accuses the Bolsonaro government of being obliged to answer a variety of demands and distrust.
"There is indigenous blood in the hands of his government," said a written statement APIB.


Increased violence against Amazon guards has sparked public attention.

"The violence that continues to increase in the territory of indigenous people is a direct impact of speeches nuanced hatred and a number of policies that suppress us," said APIB.
Who is Paulo Paulino Guajajara?
Rescuer of the indigenous tribal area who died in his late 30s was the leader of the Guajajara tribe. He has a son.


Paulo Paulino Guajajara left a son.

Guajajara is one of the largest tribal groups in Brazil, consisting of around 20 thousand people. In 2012, they formed the Guardian of the Forest to protect Arariboia's indigenous territories.
"I have been scared a few times, but we have to look up and take a stand. We are standing here to fight," Guajajara told Reuters news agency in the middle of this year.
"There is a lot of environmental destruction happening. Trees with iron-hard wood are cut down and taken out of the Amazon."
"We must protect it for the future of our children and grandchildren," Guajajara said.
